# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/_inspect.py
@source-hash: a19246c37d5eeb87
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:03Z

## Primary Purpose

Rich library's object inspection module providing interactive Python object exploration with customizable rendering options. Core component for creating formatted, syntax-highlighted displays of object attributes, methods, documentation, and values.

## Key Classes and Functions

### `Inspect` Class (L23-235)
Main renderable class implementing Rich's inspection functionality. Inherits from `JupyterMixin` for notebook compatibility.

**Constructor** (L39-64): Accepts target object and extensive configuration options:
- `obj`: Target object to inspect
- `title`: Custom display title (defaults to auto-generated)
- `help`: Show full vs. first paragraph of docstrings
- `methods`: Include callable attributes
- `docs`: Display documentation strings
- `private`: Show underscore-prefixed attributes
- `dunder`: Show double-underscore attributes  
- `sort`: Alphabetical attribute ordering
- `all`: Override to show all attributes
- `value`: Pretty-print object value

**Key Methods**:
- `_make_title()` (L66-74): Generates contextual titles based on object type
- `__rich__()` (L76-82): Rich protocol implementation returning formatted Panel
- `_get_signature()` (L84-121): Extracts callable signatures with file linking
- `_render()` (L123-214): Core rendering logic producing iterable of renderables
- `_get_formatted_doc()` (L216-235): Processes docstrings with cleaning and truncation

### Utility Functions

**`_first_paragraph()`** (L17-20): Extracts first paragraph from docstrings by splitting on double newlines.

**`get_object_types_mro()`** (L238-244): Returns Method Resolution Order tuple, handling both classes and instances.

**`get_object_types_mro_as_strings()`** (L247-257): Converts MRO to fully qualified name strings (e.g., `'json.decoder.JSONDecoder'`).

**`is_object_one_of_types()`** (L260-270): Checks if object's type hierarchy contains any specified fully qualified names.

## Dependencies and Architecture

**Internal Rich modules**:
- `.console.Group`: Grouping multiple renderables
- `.highlighter.ReprHighlighter`: Syntax highlighting for representations
- `.panel.Panel`: Bordered containers
- `.table.Table`: Tabular attribute display
- `.text.Text`: Styled text handling
- `.pretty.Pretty`: Object pretty-printing

**Standard library**: `inspect` module for introspection, signature extraction, and documentation retrieval.

## Implementation Patterns

**Configuration cascade**: `all=True` parameter automatically enables `methods`, `private`, and `dunder` options (L56-57).

**Safe attribute access**: `safe_getattr()` nested function (L130-135) catches exceptions during attribute retrieval, displaying errors instead of crashing.

**Conditional rendering**: Renders different sections (signature, docs, value, attributes) based on object type and configuration flags.

**Sorting strategy**: Custom sort key (L126-128) prioritizes callables first, then alphabetical by stripped attribute names.

## Critical Constraints

- File linking in signatures requires accessible source files
- Exception handling prevents crashes from problematic attributes
- MRO utilities handle edge cases with metaclasses and abstract base classes
- Docstring processing includes control code escaping for safe display
